text:
e="preserve">A level crossing (also called a grade crossing, a railway crossing, or a railroad crossing) is a place where a railway line and a road meet each other on the same level. This means that the grades (the road and the track) are not separated by using a bridge or a tunnel. Usually, there are signs indicating the crossing. There may also be barriers/gates that go down before a train passes.
Since level crossings are dangerous (there are many accidents), they are usually grade separated once there is more traffic, or high speed trains.
